title: Black music in America: from then till now
creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Richard Kerns, William H. Barnett and Hugh A Robertson
brief_description: Presents the history of black people’s contribution to American music from the pioneer days until 1970. Features among others; Louis Armstrong, Mahalia Jackson, Duke Ellington, Count Bassie, Nina Simone and what is reported to be the only footage of Bessie Smith.
